pros: - Location was accessable by a few different roots. - might be able to get a trade and possibly bank hours to be fully paid for school towards a trade.
cons: - management and people. Most of them are stuck on the 88 Olympics. No real training in life. - the selection process for taking a trade was based on personal favoritism. - no overtime, apparently bank time was publicly told I was not getting paid on group chat and seemed like only a few people had banked time. - location based clocking in for any on call emergency. - teams reporting in where one coworker gets opinionated on when you input it, (eventually I just live updated it on the phone all day and left). - got constant reminders that the one truck was this persons truck all the time, asked my spineless supervisor to tell the wanna be plumber and I got reminded of seniority which doesn't make sense. - how they let you go, they will say it's in the letter, the letter will say without cause.

pros: This is a great short-term seasonal or first job.
cons: Don’t stick around as they don’t give a crap. Lots of potential- zero fulfillment.

job_title: Ski Lift Operator in Calgary, AB
pros:
not much to do
nice people
cons:
it's really cold
it's really boring

pros: Nothing apart from the clients and satisfaction from coaching them.
cons:
Oh where to begin.
A incompetent and unprofessional management team that sees staff as disposable with no ongoing career support and training. Lacking communication skills and effective channels of communication to address issues. 
When formal complaints are made having senior management not turn up to meetings with no communication. When they do, admit they have not read nor seen the document in question at the basis of the complaint. 
Are constantly chased to follow things up.
Cancel meetings hours before stating “forgot to put it in my diary come back Wednesday”

When held to the meeting from a strongly worded reply I was bullied and dismissed. 
Took months for any “resolution” still actually not resolved and gave up trying to get issues resolved. 

Management in other organizations have confirmed what happened was wrong and are appalled by what they subjected staff to and level of managerial incompetence

pros: People are great, awesome perks especially if you’re just looking for a fun place to work
cons: Company struggles to figure out what it’s mandate is and leadership goes in circles trying to make money/ move the organization forward. Fun place to work but very little accountability or traction

pros: Fun team to work with. Free lift pass + reciprocal lift tickets.
cons: Often disorganized management. Hard to get many hours.

pros: Hill perks. gym perks, meet new people
cons: Poor communication and unorganized. Hours all over.

review_title: Fun place to work, But not a lot of growth opportunities

job_title: Tube Park Attendant in Calgary, AB
pros:
Great people
Free skii pass
Outside work
cons:
Terrible scheduling
Working in cold weather

pros: All the employees and management are amazing. I always feel as though my opinions are being heard, and I feel so included with everything going on in the park. They are always finding ways to boost employee moral with events, discounts, free lift passes, etc. Excellent room for advancement - I started in an entry-level position and within a month had been promoted to a management position. Now five months later, roles are shifting within my department and I am likely going to be promoted again.
cons: Pay is lower than similar jobs, however WinSport in a non-profit organization. They make up for the lower pay with a great work atmosphere and employee perks here at the park.

job_title: Hockey and Skating Instructor in Calgary, AB
pros: The people are amazingly nice, friendly and kind. I had an absolute joy working at the arena and being a part of the team and I wish I could have remained there. The perks were great as well, even if I never took advantage of them.
cons: The pay and hours weren't quite at a level where I could justify supporting myself just on working for WinSport alone. Attempts to work in additional departments or get extra work fell on deaf ears. Leadership was good, but not always consistent. Sometimes people who were more buddies with management got work over those that actually knew what they were doing.

pros: Great place to work, good culture, good on-hill benefits, great teams, benefits good. VERY different business but manageable.
cons: seem to change their direction a lot, many departments still do not communicate enough with each other, everyone does not seem to have the team atmosphere in which they preach. Need to find the balance between sport and business, culture still needs work and have yet to figure this element out despite the new changes implemented.

review_title: Chaos and disorganization is the name of their game
pros: I enjoyed the people I worked beside were awesome. Free ski pass is nice.
cons: They under-value their employees by providing very little positive feedback. The pay system is messed...don't expect to be paid for overtime ever, and if you leave the company, make sure you kept track of your hours and don't expect to get paid on time. Also, there is such disorganization there. Trying to get a hold of someone in admin? Good luck!

pros:
Great culture, fun place to work, excellent work-life balance, the people were awesome and like a family.  

WinSport is an important contributor to Calgary's vibrancy, and provides important services in sport and active living for young Calgarians and their families. They are also strong contributors to Canada's Olympic success, providing an integral network of support for high level athletes. It was really cool to be a part of this.

Benefits were quite good, and included reciprocal deals at partner ski resorts as well as discounts on WinSport programs like summer camps, ski lessons, ziplining, etc. Staff also received complementary season passes and a membership to a super nice gym. Really great to have if you are an active/outdoorsy person and also for young families.
cons:
The company lacked strong direction because of frequent turnover in the executive leadership team. The current executive team have been doing a better job in the last few years, so hopefully they are on the right track. Also a lot of changes and "restructures" in upper/middle management which were stressful and negatively affected company morale.

WinSport is constantly struggling financially because of the number of sport initiatives they have to support on their own without much help from the government. This creates a constant pressure on the departments to cut costs and make money, which is stressful and not always realistic. 

Pay is below average and reflects that WinSport is a not-for-profit organization. Benefits somewhat make up for this.

pros: Staff are generally very commited to the organization, the Olympic Legacy from 1988 is a strong motivating factor throughout the organization
cons: Sometimes limits to budgets cause difficulties, as it is a not- for-profit organization
